greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, row sums = odd Fibonacci numbers, A014437
comment: Row sums = A014437 starting (1, 3, 5, 13, 21, 55, 89, 233, 377,...). The generating triangle M (alternate columns of (1,2,2,2,...) and (1,0,0,0,...)
has an eigensequence of (1, 3, 5, 13, 21, 55, 89,...); i.e. the odd Fibonacci
numbers; such that M * (1, 1, 3, 5, 13,...) shifts the latter sequence to the left.
Sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Let M = an infinite lower triangular matrix with alternate columns of
diagonalized with the rest zeros. Triangle A177995 = M * Q.
